results.title: The Great Firewall Cracked, Briefly. A People Shined Through.
results.abstract: China’s censors finally blocked Clubhouse, but not before users were able to bypass the caricatures painted by government-controlled media and freely discuss their hopes and fears.

results.title: You Can’t Find a Laptop. Or a Car?
results.abstract: Buying electronics now is rough. Be patient. Shop around. And try not to break anything important.

results.title: ‘I’m Not a Cat,’ Says Lawyer Having Zoom Difficulties
results.abstract: The video was immediately shared widely and brought joy to many. The lawyer, Rod Ponton, said he was happy people got a much-needed laugh.

results.abstract: Traditional automakers and tech-focused companies, like Tesla, race to rule the future of cars.

results.title: In China, an App Offered Space for Debate. Then the Censors Came.
results.abstract: For a little while, the social media platform Clubhouse provided the rare opportunity for cross-border dialogue on contentious topics free from the country’s usual tight controls.
results.byline: By Amy Chang Chien and Amy Qin

results.title: Clearview AI’s Facial Recognition App Called Illegal in Canada
results.abstract: Canadian authorities declared that the company needed citizens’ consent to use their biometric information, and told the firm to delete facial images from its database.
